bibl.title: Gwoo Shee Ah Look v. United States. Affadvit.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: National Archives and Records Administration, Seattle Branch, Washington
msIdentifier.collection: RG 21: US District Court, Western Division of Washington, Seatle

div1.p: United States of America, State of Oregon, County of Multnomah.} ss. 2647

I, A.L. Clark, being first duly sworn according to law, depose and day that I am a regular practicing attorney and connected with the law firm of Wilbur & Spencer in the City of Portland, State of Oregon; that on the 5th day of November, 1913, the firm of Wilbur & Spencer in connection with this affiant was employed as attorneys to defend and look after the interests of Gwoo Shee Ah Look, who was arrested in a raid made by the police of the City of Portland, on the night of the 4th of November, 1913; that thereafter I immediately went to the said City Jail where I found J.H. Brbour, Inspector of Immigration, who at that time was conducting an investigation and examination of certain Chinese persons including Gwoo Shee Ah Look arrested the night previous; that thereafter within a day or two the said Gwoo Shee Ah Look on the authority of the said J.H. Barbour was removed to the County Jail where she was confined on the charge placed against her named in the petition for writ of habeas corpus; that white the said Gwoo Shee Ah Look was confined in the County Jail and before her testimony had been taken and before the testimony of other witnesses in said matter had been taken this affiant informed said J.H. Barbour that he together with the firm of Wilbur & Spencer represented said Gwoo Shee Ah Look and requested permission to consult and visit her in the County Jail, which permission was refused.

I further depose and say that I thereafter and before said hearing had been had I requested the said J.H. Barbour for the privilege of being present for the purpose of cross examination of witnesses whose testimony might be taken; that the said J.H. Barbour
Wilbur & Spencer Attorneys-At-Law Portland Oregon -1-
knew and stated to me that he would place my name as the attorney for the said Gwoo Shee Ah Look and that I would be advised of any proceedings had at the proper time.

I further depose and say that the said J.H. Barbour, as such Immigration Officer, thereafter took the testimony of the said Gwoo Shee Ah Look and took the testimony of the said L.A. Harms and J.M. Wise, the two police officers, without the presence of the attorneys of the said Gwoo Shee Ah Look or without their knowledge that such examination and testimony was being taken; that after the conclusion of the taking of said testimony said J.H. Barbour prsented to me a transcript of the testimony with the statement that such testimony by way of affidavits as might be thought useful could then be presented to him and that he would attach the same to his record and forward the same to the Secretary of Commerce and Labor.

This affiant further says that although the said J.H. Barbour well knew before the taking of the testimony of said witnesses that this affiant together with the firm of Wilbur & Spencer had been employed to defend said Gwoo Shee Ah Look and had requested the right and privilege of being present at the examination; that they were not given the right nor advised of said hearing nor allowed to be present at the time of said testimony.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 24th day of April, 1914.
div1.ab: Ruth Van Name Notary Public, State of Oregon.

figure.ab: Ruth Van Name Notary Public State of Oregon

div1.p: United States of America, District of Oregon } ss.
Due and timely service of the within Affidavit and the receipt of a duly certified copy thereof, all at the City of Seattle in the Northern District of Washington is hereby admitted.
In the District Court of the United States for the District of Oregon Wash
In the Matter of the Amended Application for a Writ of Habeas Corpus for Gwoo Shee Ah Look.
2x Filed in the U.S. District Court, Western Dist. of Washington, APR 27 1914 Frank L. Crosby by EML Deputy.
Wilbur & Spencer A.L. Clark Attorneys for Petitioner
